qas.question: What are built in many places through the cities?
What do the different Carnival groups perform together?
What do the topics of the shows put on at the tablados typically relate to?
What type of rhythmic figures are performed by the drummers playing the tamboril?
What sort of touch do the vedettes provide to the parades?

context: During the celebration, theaters called <a0_0>tablados<a0_0/> are built in many places throughout the cities, especially in Montevideo. Traditionally formed by men and now starting to be open to women, the different Carnival groups (Murgas, Lubolos or Parodistas) perform a kind of popular <a1_0>opera<a1_0/> at the tablados, singing and dancing songs that generally relate to <a2_0>the social and political situation<a2_0/>. The 'Calls' groups, basically formed by drummers playing the tamboril, perform <a3_0>candombe<a3_0/> rhythmic figures. Revelers wear their festival clothing. Each group has its own theme. Women wearing elegant, bright dresses are called vedettes and provide a <a4_0>sensual<a4_0/> touch to parades.
